cmp.business
Class TestDate

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--cmp.business.TestDate
public class TestDate
extends java.lang.Object

Validate the BigDate class it is bug-free. Also demonstrate and exercise the various methods.

Constructor Summary
TestDate()
           
 
Method Summary
static void demoDate()
          show off some of the things BigDate can do See also cmp.holidays.Holiday to compute various holidays and cmp.holidays.IsHoliday to tell if a given day is a holiday.

          Display an error message and exit.

public static void demoDate()
show off some of the things BigDate can do See also cmp.holidays.Holiday to compute various holidays and cmp.holidays.IsHoliday to tell if a given day is a holiday.

public static void show(java.lang.String desc,
                        int yyyy,
                        int mm,

Display a date and its ordinal on System.out.
Parameters:
desc - a description of the date to label it.
yyyy - the year to display.
mm - the month to display.
dd - the day of the month to display.

testAge

public static void testAge(BigDate fromDate,
                           BigDate toDate,
                           int samples,
                           boolean showDetails)
Test that the age routine generates plausible results.
Parameters:
fromDate - earliest date to test.
toDate - last date to test.
samples - how many random pairs to test.
showDetails - true if want details of individual tests

testDate

public static void testDate(int fromYear,
                            int toYear)
Check for bugs in toOrdinal and toGregorian.
Parameters:
fromYear - the first year to test.
toYear - the last year to test.

testISOWeekNumber

public static void testISOWeekNumber(int fromYear,

Test getISOWeekNumber and getISODayOfWeek.
Parameters:
fromYear - first year to test.
toYear - last year to test.

testNormalize

public static void testNormalize(int yyyy,
                                 int mm,
                                 int dd)
Test Normalize by displaying how an invalid date is converted.
Parameters:
yyyy - the year to test, may be negative or bigger than 4 digits.
mm - the month to test.
dd - the day of the month to test.
